formation: Verb-casual + も, い-Adjective + も, な-Adjective + も, Noun + も
explanation:
### Name
- も（追加）

### Meaning and function
- Adds an item to an already mentioned or implied set: “also,” “too,” “as well.”
- Can carry emphasis like “even,” especially with quantities/counters or when used with negation (“not even …”).

### Form and templates
- N + も
  - Core additive pattern.
  - With case markers:
    - が／を／は are replaced by も: N + も
    - に／へ／で／から／まで／と／より take も after them: Nにも／Nへも／Nでも／Nからも／Nまでも／Nとも／Nよりも
- AもBも + same predicate
  - Lists multiple items that share the same action/state (“both A and B …”).
  - With a negative predicate: “neither A nor B …”
- Number/counter + も + predicate
  - Positive: emphasis (“as many/much as …”).
  - Negative: “not even …” (e.g., not even one/once).
- Verb/adjective content as the “thing” being added
  - V(dict/ない/た) + の／こと + も … (nominalize the clause, then add も)
  - い-adj + の + も … (refers to “the one(s) that are …” as a noun, then add も)
  - い-adj(〜く) + も + ない / な-adj + でも + ない
    - Fixed negative patterns meaning “not even …” or, in paired form 〜くも〜くもない, “neither … nor …”
- Positioning
  - Attach も directly to the focused element (the item that is “also/too”).
  - Sentence-initial topical use is possible: [focused phrase] + も、… (do not combine with は there).
- Politeness/conjugation
  - も does not conjugate; it works with both plain and です／ます predicates.

### Usage notes and constraints
- Register/frequency: Neutral, very common in speech and writing; natural at all politeness levels.
- Scope/focus: Moving も changes what is being added; place it immediately after the element you want to mark.
- Particle behavior:
  - Replace は／が／を with も.
  - Stack も after other case/relational particles (に／へ／で／から／まで／と／より).
- Multiple も: Using も on more than one element in the same clause is common to express “both/all.”
- Interrogatives + も:
  - With a negative predicate: “none/no …” (e.g., 誰も…ない, 何も…ない).
  - With an affirmative predicate: “every/any …” (e.g., いつも, どこも) — common fixed expressions at this level.
- Orthography: Always written も (hiragana).

### Common mistakes
- Stacking は／が／を before も (e.g., Xはも/がも/をも). Use Xも (も replaces them).
- Placing も in the wrong spot, accidentally changing the focus of “also.”
- Trying to put も after です／ます. Attach も to the noun/phrase before the copula (or use で + も when appropriate).
- Using も to connect full sentences; use sentence connectors like また／それに for sentence-level “also.”

### Related grammar
- は: Topic/contrast marker. も is additive; it includes another item in the same set rather than contrasting.
- さえ／まで: “Even” with stronger sense of extremity/limit; さえ is more focused than も.
- また／それに: Sentence-level “also/in addition” (adverbs/conjunctives), not a particle on a noun.
- AもBも vs AとB: AもBも emphasizes that both share the same predicate; と simply joins items as a combined NP.
- でも: Can be で + も after nouns/な-adjectives, but also forms other meanings (“even if,” “or something”); don’t confuse with plain additive も.

examples.jp: 私も行きます。
examples.en: I’ll go too.

examples.jp: その映画も見た。
examples.en: I also saw that movie.

examples.jp: この店もあの店よりも安いですか。
examples.en: Is this shop also cheaper than that one?

examples.jp: 駅にも近いので、歩いて行けます。
examples.en: It’s close to the station too, so we can walk.

examples.jp: 家でも、仕事をします。
examples.en: I work at home as well.

examples.jp: 先生からもメールが届きました。
examples.en: I got an email from the teacher too.

examples.jp: 夜中までも起きていた。
examples.en: I stayed up even until midnight.

examples.jp: 友達ともいつも旅行に行きます。
examples.en: I always travel with friends as well.

examples.jp: 誰も答えられませんでした。
examples.en: No one could answer.

examples.jp: 猫も犬も好きです。
examples.en: I like both cats and dogs.

examples.jp: 彼も彼女も来なかった。
examples.en: Neither he nor she came.

examples.jp: 三時間も待ちました。
examples.en: I waited for as long as three hours.

examples.jp: 一つも残っていない。
examples.en: Not even one is left.

examples.jp: 走るのも楽しい。
examples.en: Running is fun too.

examples.jp: 朝ごはんを食べないのも体によくない。
examples.en: Not eating breakfast is also bad for your health.

examples.jp: この本を選んだのもあなたですか。
examples.en: Were you also the one who chose this book?

examples.jp: 新しいのも古いのもあります。
examples.en: We have both new ones and old ones.

examples.jp: 安くも高くもない。
examples.en: It’s neither cheap nor expensive.

examples.jp: 便利でも不便でもない場所です。
examples.en: It’s a place that’s neither convenient nor inconvenient.

examples.jp: どこも混んでいて、座れませんでした。
examples.en: Everywhere was crowded, so I couldn’t get a seat.

negativeExamples.en: I’ll go even if it rains.

negativeExamples.jp: たとえ高くても買います。
negativeExamples.en: I’ll buy it even if it’s expensive.

negativeExamples.jp: もっとゆっくり話してください。
もし時間があれば、手伝ってください。
negativeExamples.en: If you have time, please help.

negativeExamples.jp: コーヒーでもいかがですか。
negativeExamples.en: Would you like some coffee or something?

negativeExamples.jp: 高くても安くても関係ない。
negativeExamples.en: Whether it’s expensive or cheap, it doesn’t matter.

negativeExamples.jp: それでも私は諦めない。
negativeExamples.en: Even so, I won’t give up.
